text: Does Julia have something which can generate .gff3 files from .gb (genebank) files?

elements.text: Does Julia have something which can generate .gff3 files from .gb (genebank) files?

text: Thanks, will have a look at this!

elements.text: Thanks, will have a look at this!

text: This was only recently brought into BioJulia, so the interfaces may not conform to other biojulia packages yet. But I used it like 6 months ago and it worked well

text:
Got it. I did run into some troubles, erroring on what should be an ordinary .gb file from NCBI
<https://github.com/BioJulia/GenomicAnnotations.jl/issues/7>

elements.text: Got it. I did run into some troubles, erroring on what should be an ordinary .gb file from NCBI

text: The bug was introduced when changing the interface to conform with the rest of BioJulia, but it’s been fixed. It may take some time for the new version to be registered in General, though

elements.text: The bug was introduced when changing the interface to conform with the rest of BioJulia, but it’s been fixed. It may take some time for the new version to be registered in General, though

text:
Thanks, it works no. I deleted the last line and now it works.

I'm still having problems though, I can load the gb file, but not sure how to save it as a gff(3) file?

The docs mention a function `printgff`, but when I use it I get a `ERROR: UndefVarError: printgff not defined`. There's also something called `GFF.Writer`, but it is missing a doc string, and I'm a bit unsure where the gb file goes into the input.

elements.text:

text:
`printgff` was removed recently, I’ll update the docs. You can use
`open(GFF.Writer, filepath) do w`
    `for chr in chrs`
        `write(w, chrs)`
    `end`
`end`
